phrases: Ladies and gentlemen, good evening.
The girl sleeping in the house of the poisoner...
However, the next misfortune then silently creeps up and suddenly appears before us.
Indeed, just like that single letter that was delivered to an innocent soul.
Act 12: Encore
Excuse me?
Father, what did you say just now?
Your engagement to Albert... I have called it off.
All right?
What is the meaning of this?
What brought this on?
I have been hearing some unsavory rumors about the Morcerf family.
But that does not mean you have to...
I cannot believe this!
I do not understand you.
As I recall, you were never very enthusiastic over the engagement from the very beginning.
You do not understand anything, do you, Father?
Do not treat my life like it was one of your stocks or bonds!
Here is a quick lesson for you.
There are only two kinds of people in this world, winners and losers.
Eugenie, I am only thinking of what is best for you.
Liar.
You are thinking of what is best for you!
Damn it, Mondego, you really blew it.
Sorry, but I plan to make it through this in one piece.
I must say, it is hard to believe you are the Mondego I used to know.
You have done well for yourself.
How do you know about that?
A certain gentleman filled me in.
Who?!
Who was it?!
Oh, I cannot tell you that...
But that is not important.
How much do you want?
Give
Me everything you have got!
If you want to keep me from talking, stuff my mouth with gold!
It is an honor to see you again, Mademoiselle.
Marquis Cavalcanti?
Do you have some business here?
Yes, I have a meeting with your father.
More financial dealings?
I was hoping that I might be of some assistance to you.
I want to take everything that causes you sorrow and make them go away.
There is no reason for you to do that for me.
Does a man need a reason to be in love?
No!
Let go of me!
I will scream!
You are acquainted with the Count of Monte Cristo, I take it?
The gossip dealing with the Morcerf family was apparently leaked by him.
What are you talking about?
I must say, though, I find it unlikely that the Count's information would be incorrect.
Why are you telling me this?
The thought of seeing sadness on the face of the woman I love is unbearable.
Cut it out.
There is no reason for you to be in love with me.
Why would the Count of Monte Cristo do such a thing?
I wonder what she thinks about the engagement being called off?
Why do not you just ask the girl?
No, this problem might be bigger than just the two of us.
Albert...
You are serious about her, are not you?
I guess it is true that you do not realize how important something is until you lose it.
Goodness, this is amazing...
This is your daughter's big night, after all.
Money is no object.
My daughter is a lucky girl.
She never would have been able to sell out the opera house on her own merits.
This would not have happened without your gracious support.
So, are you willing to go along with this?
Breaking it off with Albert?
You can hardly call it breaking it off.
Nothing had even started.
Maybe, but you were engaged.
This is something that both our families decided.
Why do you seem so hurt, then?
Who is he?
Who is this Count of Monte Cristo person?
Did the Count have something to do with this?
He is manipulating things behind the scenes.
It sounds like he was the source of all those bad rumors...
Bad rumors?
Personally, I do not care about all that political gossip,
I really miss the old days, you know?
The three of us would run around the meadow, not even noticing when the sun went down.
When did it start?
When did we start being so awkward around each other,
When you were on your trip to Luna, what happened to you?
You two have not been the same since that trip.
You are right, we have not.
What does Albert think about all this?
I have not heard from him.
Has he said anything to you?
You two are best friends, right?
Best friends, huh?
Franz, is something wrong?
I am sorry.
I do not really understand him these days, either.
Did something happen between you and Albert?
We got into a fight.
Albert should not associate with the Count anymore...
Thanks for lending an ear.
I am sorry I could not be more helpful.
Still...
What?
I am relieved.
Well, whatever you might say about it, it looks like you really do care about Albert.
Oh, geez...
Is it that obvious?
No one can hide it when they are pining away for someone.
Maybe the reason your piano performance that night at Auteuil was so great...
No way...
The feelings you have for someone manifest themselves in your art.
Is not that right?
Yeah, he would not be here...
After all, we are still fighting...
Yeah, he would not be here...
What is keeping her?
Is not Eugenie ready yet?!
She is still getting ready.
Are you sure you are feeling well, Mademoiselle?
I am fine.
This is the opera house performance that I have always dreamed of.
It is the strangest thing.
Unlike the way it is outside the city walls,
What is it?
Albert, you should always listen to your feelings.
You cannot lie to yourself about how you really feel.
Have you always been true to yourself, Mother?
This is Paris.
Perhaps it truly is a paradise where you can find...
But if you lose your courage, you will simply be swept along on the currents.
You are not going to show up, Albert?
Are you looking for someone?
Lucien!
Oh, I get it.
Mother invited you, did not she?
Thanks to her kind influence.
I am dedicating my performance tonight to lovers.
I hope you two enjoy it.
No.
For tonight, you should play for yourself and for the person that you love.
Pianists are allowed to do that.
That is easy for you to say...
I suppose it is.
Albert, my boy, I am sorry, but the hall is already filled with invited guests.
I have an invitation.
Eugenie gave it to me.
The past is the past.
Let us pretend it never happened.
I was invited by Eugenie!
You have no right to turn me away!
Did you get that hot temper of yours from your father?
This has nothing to do with my father!
I am my own man!
You are going to let me pass!
And just what are you going to do about it?
You have no power.
You have no money.
You are nothing but a spoiled brat!
Shut up!
Maybe so, but I still...
Damn it!
Let me go!
What is this commotion?
This is supposed to be an auspicious occasion.
Oh, you were invited, too?
Yes, by Madame.
My wife seems to be feeling a little out of sorts.
Would you mind keeping her company for me?
I am sorry, but I am not in the mood today.
Excuse me.
Cut it out, Lucien!
Use your head, then!
You will never get in through the front door.
Crap...
I do not owe you any favors or anything,
Are you really sleeping with Eugenie's mother?
It is all part of my job.
You will never understand your whole life, and you do not have any need to.
Anyway, be there for her and listen to her performance.
You love Eugenie, do not you?
Let us go.
Albert?
Is that you?
You are a little late, do not you think?!
I was right here the whole time.
I had a little trouble getting in.
You do not mean my father, do you?
It is all right, I heard you play just fine.
It was really great.
You were radiant out there.
My heart was pounding!
Idiot.
If I would known you were here, I would have been able to play even better.
I would have been playing for you.
Eugenie...
I am sorry.
I know I am not your fiancee anymore.
That does not matter.
I do not care.
Oh!
Here.
What?
You like these, do not you?
Well, sure, but you are supposed to bring a bouquet of flowers.
Oh, right.
I guess flowers would have been better...
You are such a fool.
You have not changed one bit since we were kids.
Out in the meadow, I wanted you to pick flowers for me,
They were delicious, though.
Mademoiselle Eugenie!
It will not do to keep your audience waiting.
You!
Wait, Albert!
Listen to one more song.
I will be playing it just for you.
It looks like you have been shut out.
I would not be so sure about that.
Ladies and gentlemen!
Let us have a warm round of applause for Mademoiselle Eugenie!
What do you think you are doing?!
This is my performance!
Yes, one that I arranged.
That jerk!
You do not know when to quit!
My daughter has set out on the road to a bright future!
Do not ruin it for her!
You do not have any right to be here!
All the seats for tonight's performance were bought out by Marquis Cavalcanti!
You have lost, so go away!
Count...
Why, whatever is the matter?
You are not looking well at all.
Count!
Albert?
I am... so frustrated...
At how weak and pathetic I am...
Count of Monte Cristo!
You are under suspicion of criminal activity.
I will have to ask you to come with me to the station as the prime suspect...
Monsieur Villefort...
Villefort's investigation is relentless.
Why?
When I go to visit the Count, I sit and speak with Haidee for the first time.
Act 13: Haidee
Bide your time, and hold out hope!
